title: Blood Press. & Cholesterol | 1 of 2
question_text:
High Blood Pressure & High Cholesterol: $9$
High Blood Pressure & Normal Cholesterol: $12$ Normal Blood Pressure & High Cholesterol: $11$ Normal Blood Pressure & Normal Cholesterol: $21$
The data above summarizes data about the occurrences of two medical measurements, blood pressure (BP) and cholesterol level, for $53\text{ individuals}$ who were measured at the infirmary of a large steel mill as part of their annual check-up.
Given that an individual has normal blood pressure, what is the probability that the individual has normal cholesterol?
solution:
Since the problem states the individual has normal blood pressure, only focus on the $(11+21) = 32\text{ people}$ with normal blood pressure. Of these $32$, there are $21$ with normal cholesterol.

Therefore, the probability that a person has normal cholesterol, given that he or she has normal blood pressure, is $\frac{21}{32}$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
